channel.description: Recent content in Guda, H. on Harish Guda

item.title: Seemingly-Beneficial Interventions
item.description: We analyze the key property of interventions that make them beneficial to one or all members in an interaction.

item.title: Your Uber Is Arriving: Managing On-Demand Workers Through Surge Pricing, Forecast Communication, and Worker Incentives
item.description: We study how an on-demand service platform can coordinate its workforce through forecast-sharing, worker bonuses and surge pricing in a geographically dispersed marketplace using gig-economy workers.

item.title: An Economic Analysis of Agricultural Support Prices in Developing Economies
item.description: We study the role of guaranteed support prices in agriculture under supply yield uncertainty and demand-side budget constraints.

item.title: Optimal Policy for a Stochastic Scheduling Problem with Applications to Surgical Scheduling
item.description: We study a variant of the classical appointment scheduling problem, where idling is not allowed, but advancing a patient’s surgery is allowed. We show that the Shortest-Variance-First (SVF) rule is optimal for our variant.
